abstract_summ: This study aims to investigate the neurological findings via obtained face-to-face anamnesis and detailed neurological examination in patients with COVID-19.Patients were categorized into 2 groups based on timing of developing neurological manifestations: the "Neuro first" group had neurological manifestations upon initial assessment, and the "COVID first" group developed neurological symptoms greater than 24 h after hospitalization.RESULTS Of 841 patients hospitalized with COVID-19 (mean age 66.4 years, 56.2% men) 57.4% developed some form of neurological symptom.We aim to determine whether neurological manifestations are common in hospitalized COVID-19 patients and to describe their main characteristics.CONCLUSIONS Neurological manifestations are common in hospitalized COVID-19 patients.
title_summ: Compliance with international guidelines in adults with encephalitisA prospective clinical study of detailed neurological manifestations in patients with COVID-19Neurologic manifestations in hospitalized patients with COVID-19: The ALBACOVID registry.New onset neurologic events in people with COVID-19 infection in three regions in China.Neurological manifestations and COVID-19: Experiences from a tertiary care center at the Frontline.
title_abstract_phrases: This study aims to investigate the neurological findings via obtained face-to-face anamnesis and detailed neurological examination in patients with COVID-19.A prospective clinical study of detailed neurological manifestations in patients with COVID-19BACKGROUND: COVID-19 is a virus pandemic.RESULTS Of 841 patients hospitalized with COVID-19 (mean age 66.4 years, 56.2% men) 57.4% developed some form of neurological symptom.Patients were categorized into 2 groups based on timing of developing neurological manifestations: the "Neuro first" group had neurological manifestations upon initial assessment, and the "COVID first" group developed neurological symptoms greater than 24 h after hospitalization.We aim to determine whether neurological manifestations are common in hospitalized COVID-19 patients and to describe their main characteristics.
